title: AKDMKS : Akademiks clothing : 002 : "Pink & Blue Script"
content:
Akademiks is an NYC-based clothing company, established in 1999. I am posting a series of fonts used by Akademiks. Please help me ID the fonts.

"Pink & Blue Script"

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110508004822im_/http:/typophile.com/files/akademiks-tee-42789_5711.jpg)

I think this might be the same face as "Trinidad"
author: dirtcastle

comments.content:
Don't think this is the same as the Trinidad font (Sport Script/Spoleto). The A here looks (badly) customized. If this is a font, the k should be a good clue. Still looking..

- Mike Yanega

Searching freebies at Dafont I found [Lauren Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20110508004822/http:/www.dafont.com/lauren-script.font?nb_ppp=50&classt=alpha&text=Akademiks), a shareware font by De Nada Industries. I think it matches the lower case fairly well if you add a loop to the d. I think the A is a hand-drawn monster.

- Mike Yanega

Thanks. Ya, with a heavy stroke, the lowercase of Lauren Script is pretty close, although I think there are many variations on this script style.

BTW, where can I find the "hand-drawn monster" font? ;-)
